cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles SSW of Great Exuma Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to track WNW across or just north of Cuba today, turn NW toward the Florida Keys Saturday, then move northward just offshore the west coast of Florida and inland across the Florida Panhandle/Big-Bend area by late Sunday before curving northeast across the Southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend or adjacent northeast Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch for southwest Florida coast from Englewood south and east to Ocean Reef and portions of central Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Florida Keys west of Ocean Reef to the Dry Tortugas, including Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuba, the Florida Keys, west coast of Florida, northeast Gulf Coast, and inland Southeast states
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: BEAUFORT MCAS SC (closest listed point in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: Only breezy conditions (below gale force) expected as remnants pass well to the west of New Jersey
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along New Jersey coast from Fred
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–3 inches of rain to southern New Jersey mid-week, mainly August 18–19
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river/urban flooding possible if locally heavy rain bands reach Delaware Valley; otherwise no significant hazards for port operations
